title: The Plat Experience
body:
Look at this picture and what do you see?

https://imgur.com/qzJfGGx

I see team, holding back a player that is trying to rank up, yet that player cant do anything at all to change the outcome of this game. This whole game since patch 7.22 was introduced has been RNG on who wins. The stomp or be stomped meta. The 1 death per minute is completely normal now meta. The 3 autos from Irelia level one does 90% of your health meta. On this account, I have counted the number of times I have lost lane, which is 11 times. The total number of losses I have are 43 as I am writing this post. What in the actual hell am I supposed to do to carry games today? Seems like whenever im somewhat decently fed top with 3/0 kills, someone on the enemy team is 7/0 already. Seriously, what is the strategy behind winning today? Because I seriously have been trying everything to find it since season 8 started and have yet to find anything. The only strategy that somewhat works is to completely dominate your lane and roam, which thats not always possible to do if the enemy laner is playing extremely passive or if youre getting ganked 24/7. A few games ago, I got ganked 13 times in 16 minutes, not exaggerating either, I counted 13 times where I got ganked while my jungler ganked twice.

This game is getting wack, and if season 9 changes nothing the first few months, then im truly gone from this game and am just gonna focus fully on college and work instead.

replies.body: I remember a year or two ago, people used to say 'all games are winnable so long as you carry'.  Funny how people don't dare to say that anymore, because they've realized how utterly cretinous a statement it is.

> [{quoted}](name=XL BENCH PRESS,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0mlHlKAw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-22T09:04:48.612+0000)
>
> I remember a year or two ago, people used to say 'all games are winnable so long as you carry'.  Funny how people don't dare to say that anymore, because they've realized how utterly cretinous a statement it is.

Back then the games were winnable if you were good enough tho that statement is true. Sure one out of 10 games might just be unlucky team mates due to afks/inters, but you could actually carry with skill.

Today, you mindlessly run around one shotting others, get one shotted, theres no time to react, there is no carrying if youre good. Only way to win is truly if you have luck.

Yeah, more probably, "back then you were under-ranked enough so that you could solo carry, and now that you are ranked closer to your actual skills it's harder and you actually have to collaborate with your team".

Let me put it that way: if you had won that game, what should the ENEMY botlane, mid and jungle should say? YOU played well, but THEY played well too, and they are 4 and you're just 1 player. So why should you have been able to win that game 1v4?

Well, that's surprising. How did you end up in Plat, then? No sarcasm intended (no really), but that's not simply being held back, that's being pulled down horribly...

Riot changed a lot of things in season 8 patch. I had a specific playstyle with full lethality runes (nobody took on Jayce). They also took away a rune I used a lot, it was the equivalent of Phase Rush but instead of having to hit 3 separate times to activate, you only had to do 30% of their health in a couple seconds. Also Jayce was meta at the time, being a otp on Jayce I was able to abuse that a lot. Today Jayce is ranked Tier 3 because he doesnt have enough mobility or powerspike anymore to end games unlike a lot of meta champions. Thats one of the main reasons, the other reason is simply because people die too much today compared to season 7 and before.

Unlucky.

Though, to get back to your original complaint about team holding you back, thing is you should expect to lose at least 30-40% of your games through no fault of your own no matter what, no matter the meta, just due to it being a team-game. And that's not a problem, because a 65+% winrate is more than enough to climb quickly.

One game like that is frustrating, but it's nothing unexpected. What would be worrying is all your losses being like that AND having a ~50% winrate.

Well even in silver i saw too much RNGesus, even more in silver 1, gold 1 and plat 1 maybe its because i play so much adc so idk and the only ''smurfs'' nowadays i had seen winning everything they can are junglers and rarely midlaners (I think the concentration of so much power in one role like jungle affected so much the health of soloq along with the autofill changes to the ranked matchmaking) , also i have seen less people saying the same statment ''if you are good enough, you will carry'' this season 8 and at the end of season 7 :/

Honestly, I'm more worried about the threads that say "the team which wins is the team with the less bad players" than by the threads who say "you can't solo-carry anymore", and I have seen more of them recently. 

LoL is a team-game, and one player shouldn't single-handedly determine the outcome of a game. It's bad both way, whether that guy solo carries or solo throws the game.

"Many games are winnable, so long as you keep playing to win" is more appropriate

You have won 44 out of your last 80 ranked games, according to your op.gg. That's a 55% winrate. So overall you're still climbing. Maybe because you play against better players now it's harder to carry a team that doesn't play too well.
Shouldn't be your team get bettet as well if you climb?
Yeah, your team does, but the enemy team too. And the enemy team is 5 players, your team (except you) is only 4. So the increase in skills is more noticeable on the enemy team than yours.

nop. I think it was Daveyx who said, no matter what elo you're in, you'll never be happy with your team.

In my opinion it's more the matchmaking than the game itself.
The algorithm is complete trash.
Often I check teams before game starts and I can say who will win and who will lose.
But sometimes even a good algorithm couldn't help. It's the stupidity of the players itself.
The Algorithm sorts after your overall winrate/games played/Elo.
So I have 4 Plat 1-2 Teammates in my game with 49%-52% wr. Well, WOULD BE OK if they would play their normal champions. 
But NO.... Ofcourse they have to play and try new ones every game.
"Oh there is a dude in my game with 50% overall winrate but playing an Ezrael with 18 games 26% winrate. Hmmmm I AM CURIOUS WHO WILL WIN BOTLANE!!"

Or these people who have 2-3 games on EVERY champion. Then they lose lane vs skilled mains and start to blame their jungler. "OH WEY! I never expected that the 3 games Cassio would lose against that 169 games Kassadin otp!!"

Awesome game experience!

Your first statement was the closest. The matchmaking itself is garbage. I just finished playing a game with 2 plats, an IRON, a silver lol. I'd say 2/3 of my games are wonky like that. hell I played one a week or so ago that had a Bronze and a Challenger in it :P. W/E though I guess.

Sorry but you are wrong here.
I was talking about winrate.
You are talking about the placement.
The reason why Iron and Silver's can be in the same game is the hidden MMR.
It's fine.

> But sometimes even a good algorithm couldn't help. It's the stupidity of the players itself.

I don't like harsh words, usually it only serves to tilt people even more, so not a big fan of calling people stupid, but yeah, you're right, there are some problems that even the best algorithm couldn't solve.

> The algorithm is complete trash.

I must admit I have seen a couple cases where I wondered what the hell happened and it seemed absurd, but I think the algorithm is pretty good overall. Most of the times, the problems come from unbalanced premades, like a Silver1 and a Bronze4 queueing together or something like that, and that is one of those problems that even the best algorithm couldn't solve.

Do keep in mind that it's pretty hard to carry games with Jayce unless you're really wrecking lane to the point that they're inting, or if you're very pro-active and spreading your dominance across the map, though again, early on. Ideally though, you shouldn't have to.

I've only made it to silver 1 so far, so feel free to not take this to heart (I kind of expect rank shame otherwise). It's fine if you want to climb as Jayce, that's fine, but if you do, you'll want to learn how to maximize his early game power so you can beat more than your lane opponent. or hope to be paired exclusively with competent players.
https://i.imgur.com/3qlVoYR.gif[]

The only way I've found to carry in this season is to spam {{champion:91}} and first beat my laner. Rush mobi boots and a lethality item. Then roam 24/7 , if they have a weaker/squishier jg, I invade their jg, keep it warded and kill them while they're doing their buffs. That way it keeps the whole enemy team down. Sure it's not guaranteed but it worked out, had a 62% winrate over 300 games on talon. I think the trick is just pick anyone who's really bursty and constantly be thirsty

I see a team who got steamrolled by a Vladimir because they had no frontline and minimal CC, after failing to respect the early Xin Zhao ganks.  Which role is traditionally most relied upon to be a frontline and bring lockdown?  Look at how long you managed to drag out the game - 27 minutes.  Imagine if you were a tank who could lock down Vladimir while your carries dealt with him, or peel off Xin.  The closest thing they have to a tankbuster is Urgot, but you have a Sona to help counter him.

Typical solo queue, not just plat and not just bad play.  It’s all a lack of coordination.

I see a Jayce who got fed in lane, snowballed into a splitpush, and got shutdown a few times.  He probably got a couple turrets, likely outers.  Meanwhile, the enemy team won lane and snowballed, catching out his teammates and then diving the others.

Jayce works best when generally alone in a side lane, denying its farm to the enemy team while getting it all himself and forcing them to send two champs to stop him.  However, he can also roam from to win short skirmishes with well-placed shockblasts and all-ins, reset, and resume  splitpush near the next objective.  Successful roams get his team ahead, and every assist he earns during each one is roughly a wave of gold.

Try to use your lead to win map control.  Push in the enemy top laner during lane phase, drop a deep ward, and wait for the enemy jungler to show on it.  Ping for your jungler to grab the free drake.  Alternatively, invade the enemy jungle with your jungler when a buff comes up on your ward.  Let your jungler take it and return to lane.  If you take your turret, laneswap and bully their bot-lane while yours farms freely against your under-fed opponent.

There’s *so much* you can do with a fed Jayce that you should at least practice it when you can’t carry.
Learn to jungle, don’t farm creeps. Profit.

This is the experience everywhere, not just in plat, and it always has been. Of course, there are plenty of anecdotal cases where people will point out the times they remember a single champion solo 1v5ing and carrying their struggling team to victory. But this is a team game and having a team that (minus you) adds up to a KD of 6/30 probably shouldn't win.

It's the uncomfortable truth of multiplayer games, and as painful as it is at times, would feel even worse for the team that is extremely far ahead to lose to a single fed champion. 

The matchmaking system is broken right now, as it always is right before the season begins. I'm currently getting 10-12 points for a win and losing 22-24 points for a loss - it makes no sense. I'm hoping that this will be fixed when the season starts, but only time will tell.

I moved from top lane because of this. I play support now because that way I have some control over my idiot adc dying, i.e make sure they dont die by spamming heals, or I play mid lane, because if you are good mechanically, its significantly easier to carry from the mid lane compared to the jg. The main reasons are the fact that you can get yourself ahead by winning lane and setting ur opponent behind. As you are ahead you can just shove the wave on and help your jg gank other lanes, which not only improves their ganks, but nearly guarantees a kill. And in most cases you dont get a team dumb enough to blow a 15 kill lead, which is surprisingly easy to get if you play cut and dry.
Don't forget guys, it's preseason too. On your team, enemy team, etc, clowns everywhere, you're just more likely to remember those on your own team.
